p: In Ethiopia, malaria was the foremost cause of outpatient visits, accounting for 17% of all outpatient visits, and 8% of health facility admissions among all age groups and one of the top ten causes of inpatient deaths among children aged less than five years and in older individuals. 7 The socioeconomic impact of malaria is striking, although the country’s economy is based on agriculture and peak malaria transmission coincides with the planting and harvesting season. About 75% of the country is malicious, with about 68% of the country’s total population living in areas at risk of malaria. 8, 9
